channel.title: calling 1 package from whonix repo will pull all the packages
channel.description:
if someone wanted just to install for e.g sdwadate on debian, there going to be as well unnecessary packages to be installed.
``` user@user:~$ sudo apt install sdwdate Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree Reading state information... Done The following additional packages will be installed: anon-shared-helper-scripts bc bootclockrandomization docbook-xml docbook-xsl fonts-dejavu fonts-dejavu-extra icoutils inotify-tools kate-data item.title: calling 1 package from whonix repo will pull all the packages
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/Whonix/sdwdate-gui

use /usr/lib/anon-shared-helper-scripts/terminal-wrapper rather than hardcoding Konsole 

http://forums.whonix.org/t/calling-1-package-from-whonix-repo-will-pull-all-the-packages/6182/7
by adrelanos on 10:16AM - 26 Oct 18 UTC
changed 2 files with 2 additions and 2 deletions.
github.com/Whonix/anon-shared-helper-scripts

support konsole and xterm in terminal-wrapper

by adrelanos on 10:25AM - 26 Oct 18 UTC
changed 1 files with 25 additions and 3 deletions.

Package updates coming at a later time.

Read full topic
item.source: calling 1 package from whonix repo will pull all the packages

item.title: calling 1 package from whonix repo will pull all the packages
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I see. It’s because we depend on konsole as log viewer.

github.com

Whonix/sdwdate-gui/blob/master/debian/control#L17

    

  1. Maintainer: Patrick Schleizer <adrelanos@riseup.net>
    2. 

  2. Build-Depends: debhelper (>= 9), genmkfile, ruby-ronn,
    3. 

  3. dh-systemd
    4. 

  4. Homepage: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/TimeSync
    5. 

  5. Vcs-Browser: https://github.com/Whonix/sdwdate-gui
    6. 

  6. Vcs-Git: https://github.com/Whonix/sdwdate-gui.git
    7. 

  7. Standards-Version: 3.9.8
    8. 

  8. 

    9. 

  9. Package: sdwdate-gui
    10. 

  10. Architecture: all
    11. 

  11. Depends: sudo, python3, python3-pyqt5, konsole, sdwdate, kdesudo, ${misc:Depends}
    12. 

  12. Recommends: vbox-disable-timesync
    13. 

  13. Description: Sdwdate Monitor
    14. 

  14. sdwdate-gui is a systray icon monitor for sdwdate: checks sdwdate's status
    15. 

  15. and modify the tray icon accordingly. In addition, it allows the user to
    16. 

  16. restart sdwdate and view the log.
    17.

Read full topic
item.source: calling 1 package from whonix repo will pull all the packages

item.title: calling 1 package from whonix repo will pull all the packages
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
using the same command with sdwdate-gui will push too much:

Reading package lists... Done

item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The Recommends: might be too well meant. That is likely the cause. If sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends sdwdate reduces the list then

Maybe should remove the Recommends:.

github.com

Whonix/sdwdate/blob/master/debian/control#L21-L22

    

  1. Recommends: vbox-disable-timesync, timesanitycheck, bootclockrandomization,
    2. 

  2. sdwdate-gui
    3.
